Class WaypointGUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container

                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      cst420.WaypointGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class WaypointGUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation version 2 of the License.

Or, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301,USA

Purpose: Java client UI for Waypoint management. This class creates Gui components for a UI to manage waypoints. This software is meant to run on OSX, and Windows Cygwin using g++.

Ser321 Principles of Distributed Software Systems

Author:
Tim Lindquist (Tim.Lindquist@asu.edu) CIDSE - Software Engineering Ira Fulton Schools of Engineering, ASU Polytechnic
See Also:
http://pooh.poly.asu.edu/Cst420, JavaWaypointGUI.png, Serialized Form

Field Detail

frWps

protected javax.swing.JComboBox frWps
frWps is the JComboBox in the upper left of the waypoint browser.

toWps

protected javax.swing.JComboBox toWps
toWps is the JComboBox just above the Distance and Bearing JButton in the waypoint browser.

latIn

protected javax.swing.JTextField latIn
latIn is the JTextField labeled lat in the waypoint browser.

lonIn

protected javax.swing.JTextField lonIn
lonIn is the JTextField labeled lon in the waypoint browser.

eleIn

protected javax.swing.JTextField eleIn
eleIn is the JTextField labeled ele in the waypoint browser.

nameIn

protected javax.swing.JTextField nameIn
nameIn is the JTextField labeled name in the waypoint browser.

distBearIn

protected javax.swing.JTextField distBearIn
distBearIn is the JTextField to the right of the Distance and Bearing button in the waypoint browser. The field is for displaying the distance and bearing between from and to waypoints.

addrIn

protected javax.swing.JTextArea addrIn
addrIn is the JTextArea to the right of addr label. Its for entering and displaying a waypoint's address.

removeWPButt

protected javax.swing.JButton removeWPButt
removeWPButt is the JButton just below the to waypoint drop-down. When the user clicks Remove Waypoint, the waypoint named in the nameIn JTextField should be removed from the server.

addWPButt

protected javax.swing.JButton addWPButt
addWPButt is the JButton labeled Add Waypoint. When the user clicks Add Waypoint, the current values of the fields on the right of the GUI are used to create and register a new waypoint with the server

modWPButt

protected javax.swing.JButton modWPButt
modWPButt is the JButton labeled Modify Waypoint When the user clicks Modify Waypoint, the fields on the right side of the GUI are used modify an existing waypoint. The name of a Waypoint cannot be modified.

getAddrButt

protected javax.swing.JButton getAddrButt
getAddrButt is the JButton labeled Get Addr for lat/lon. This button will be used in a later assignment. When the user clicks this button, the client uses a web service to obtain the street address of the specified lat/lon.

getLatLonButt

protected javax.swing.JButton getLatLonButt
getLatLonButt is the JButton labeled Get lat/lon for Addr. This button will be used in a later assignment. When the user clicks this button, the client uses a web service to obtain the latitude and longitude of the address specified in the address text area.

distBearButt

protected javax.swing.JButton distBearButt
distBearButt is the JButton bottom button. When the user clicks Distance and Bearing, the direction and distance between the from waypoint and the to waypoint should be displayed in the distBearIn text field.

Constructor Detail

WaypointGUI

public WaypointGUI(java.lang.String title)
